name: Jlm resume
body:
Summary
I am a junior developer familiar with the fundamentals of MVC and BDD, and constantly pursuing my passion to continuously learn new languages, frameworks and techniques in order to become a better computer programmer. I have always been drawn to tech in all its forms, and over the last year, I've dabbled in many different programming languages and web development platforms. What really excites me about programming is the near-constant sense of working on an elaborate puzzle, and the great satisfaction that comes when all the pieces fit together and the final picture appears.

Check out my code projects by clicking the link below to my GitHub account.
(The picture was automatically added by LinkedIn by scraping my GitHub profile pic... I'm not actually that vain.)

Experience

Junior Developer
iNatural Corporation
Nov 2014 - April 2015 – (16 months)
Tan Commercial Building Osmena St., Brgy 2, Tangub City

Write excellent code.
Collaborate with other members of the Development team.
Learn new technologies.

AVA Web Support
Australian Veterinary Association

Education

STI College - Ozamis

Self-study of Epicodus bootcamp curriculum(learnhowtoprogram.com)


Projects:

Ruaven(Link)

This is my first app using ActiveAdmin and is intended to explore customizing ActiveAdmin. The administration portal allows administrators basic CRUD functionality as well as the ability to charge users via the Stripe API and keep track of people via the Pipeline Deals API.

AVA Calendar Listing(Link)
AVA Event Registration(Link)
Fresh2Market Salesforce Application(Link)

Tic Tac Toe(Link)
July 2014
I used HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery to build my own version of the popular game.



Skills:

JavaScript
jQuery
Angular.js
SQL
HTML
CSS
Git(TortoiseGit, SourceTree)
AJAX,
PHP(Codeigniter, Laravel, Custom PHP)
Salesforce

Interests

Technology: web applications
blogging 
gadgetry
life hacking. 
Travel: destinations
languages
Creative outlets: web design, graphic design


Others:

Responsibilities:

The Web Developer will work on both new site projects and operational support requests. This is a hands-on coding role
that requires strong individual contribution and rapid learning of new technologies as you work. You will create custom
Drupal modules and templates using PHP, write JavaScript and jQuery code from scratch, apply look & feel styling using
Compass/SASS, and build code to integrate with internalsystems. You will collaborate daily with project
managers, QA testers, and business owners for project requirements, testing phases, and code deployments. Problem
triage and quick resolution will be needed for any reported site issues.
Create a new PHP site template and write CSS from scratch to show a schedule of games.
Create responsive pages that include editorial content, ads, and pre-built site components.
Create a new editorial form in Drupal for publishing stories, photos, or video.
Retrieve and display live game scores and statistics using AJAX.
Auto import images into Drupal from Getty Images or other image source API.
Write code to integrate with a HTML5/Flash video player, Google DFP ads, and site analytics.
Fix a styling issue specifically for iOS or Android smartphones and tablets.
Key Skills:

2+ years of enterprise-level web experience (high traffic sites, complex UI features)
PHP, JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, JSON/XML are required.
Experience with responsive designs and basic Unix commands is preferred.
Writing custom modules or plugins for Drupal and Wordpress as a back-end CMS is a plus.
Bootstrap, Compass, SASS are a plus.
Git for version control is a plus.

Buod
I enjoy learning new skills, solving complicated problems, and implementing solutions that "just work".

Mga Kakayahan:node.js, JavaScript, Drupal, mysql, php, memcached, apache, c++, java, python

Elliott Foster

Education
The University of Texas at Dallas
B.S., Computer Science - May 2007
Experience
Four Kitchens
Austin, TX
Developer December 2010 - present
Accomplishments
Implemented the node.js based REST API that powers the Saturday Night Live iOS app and website.
Architected and built REST API for the Emmy Award winning The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon and NBC.com websites.
Developed and administered Integrating Node.js and Drupal training for DrupalCon Portland 2013.
Built Drupal Poetry, a responsive magnetic poetry web app.
Architected and deployed a node.js based PubSubHubbub hub for integration with the Drupal Feeds module.
Built internal development and automated deployment infrastructure.
"Core committer" for The Economist, responsible for reviewing code before it's merged to trunk.
Redeployed the search system for The Economist using hosted Apache Solr.
Responsibilities
Build and maintain custom code for clients.
Diagnose and fix performance problems on large scale Drupal sites.
Train clients in using and building high performance Drupal sites.
New Media Broadcasting Company/ Direct2Care
Glendale, CA
Head of Web Development July 2005 - December 2010
Accomplishments
Deployed Varnish reverse proxy and static file cache for MashCast Drupal system.
Deployed Apache Solr faceted search for MashCast Drupal system.
Deployed memcached and MySQL master-slave servers for scalability of the MashCast Drupal system.
Wrote data synchronization code to keep information from a multi-site network and a desktop client server in sync
Wrote code to manage, re-format, and display uploaded files such as images, videos, and audio
Created a profile based search module
Wrote a horoscopes module that populates its current astrological sign information via RSS feeds
Worked with “themers” (HTML/CSS experts) to ensure the output from Drupal modules was easy to handle at the theme layer
Responsibilities
Write Drupal modules using PHP with MySQL
Manage the release process from automated daily builds to release candidate to production release
Create monitoring suites using Nagios
Implement automated workflows for release process using C++ and Java programs and shell scripts
Relevant Skills
Expert knowledge of the Drupal content management system.
Experienced with building and deploying node.js applications in production.
Proficient in PHP, JavaScript, Python, Java, and C++ programming languages
Practical experience with relational (MySQL) and document based (MongoDB) databases.
Extremely experienced in UNIX environments and shell scripting.
Good working knowledge of and experience with the Jenkins continuous integration system.

Responsibilities
•	Configured content, blocks, views, taxonomy, context and other modules to suit use cases. 
•	Themed, developed custom module functionality in PHP.

Created a public facing information update collection and verification application which provided new integration with existing CRM and prospect management systems securely.
+ Developed in Zend Framework (MVC) with Doctrine ORM tying to a MySQL backend.
+ Integrated workflow with existing back-end technologies
+ Multi-layer security approaches to prevent spam, abuse, and fraud even with an initial anonymous entry.

Buod
I'm an adaptive programmer who enjoys new challenges and seeks continuous improvement. I'm adept at learning new skills and toolsets in web development. I'm collaborative, team-oriented, and experienced in facilitating communication. My projects emphasize performant architecture and a willingness to revise. 


SKILLSET

Ruby / Ruby on Rails
JavaScript
jQuery 
Elixir

SQL and NoSQL Databases (PostgreSQL and Couchbase)
HTML / CSS 

Git Version Control 
Test-Driven Development
Object-Oriented and Functional Programming Paradigms

ADDITIONAL
Completed courses on Coursera, Codeacademy, etc., in:
Python
Angular.js

Buod
I am a software engineer based in Austin TX, currently working for Four Kitchens building large-scale, enterprise-level web sites and web applications.

I have experience working with JavaScript (Node.js), PHP, C, Objective-C, Drupal, Meteor, Express, WordPress, Symphony, and CodeIgniter.

In my spare time you can find me working on open source projects, most of which are on my Github account: https://github.com/patrickocoffeyo. I also take time to write on my personal blog: http://patrickcoffey.io

Responsibilities
- Theming and improvement of web applications designed on an open-source CMS, i.e. Drupal
- HTML / CSS / JS code markup and testing across multiple operating systems and devices
Skills and Expertise
- Exceptional knowledge of HTML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery and Responsive web development
- You know your way around image and vector editing software (Fireworks, Illustrator, Photoshop, Gimp, etc.)
- GIT insight
- Familiar with CMSs, e.g. Drupal
- You're prompt and enjoy learning new things
- English language proficiency in both speaking and writing
Additional prefered Qualifications
- Twig
- Backbone.js
- Node.js
Required work Experience
- At least two years

Jon Peck
Lead Engineer at GiftStarter
Seattle, WashingtonInformation Technology and Services
Kasalukuyan	
GiftStarter
Nakaraan	
See Me Roar, Massachusetts General Hospital, Cut Once Productions
Edukasyon	
Cornell University
Mga Rekomendasyon	
4 mga tao na may inirekomenda Jon
209
mga koneksyon
Sumali sa LinkedIn at i-access Jon buong profile. Libre ito!
Bilang isang miyembro ng LinkedIn, sasali kayo sa 300 milyong iba pang mga propesyonal na nagpapalitan nang kanilang mga koneksyon, ideya, at pagkakataon.
Tingnan ang mga pareho ninyong kilala
Maipakilala
Diretsong kontakin si Jon
Tingnan ang Jon Buong Profile
Karanasan
Karanasan sa Trabaho
Lead Engineer
GiftStarter
Nobyembre 2014 – Ngayon (9 buwan)
Enabling group-giving with modern technology: dynamic data feeds, deep social, cloud architecture.
IT Consultant / Owner
See Me Roar
Hunyo 2000 – Nobyembre 2014 (14 taon 6 buwan)
SeeMeRoar builds high-performance, custom-tailored websites -- complete with SEO, eCommerce, and personalized training. To learn more, visit http://seemeroar.com/
Bioinformatics Software Engineer
Massachusetts General Hospital
2004 – 2014 (10 taon)
- Develop software for use by data managers, statisticians, & lab researchers
- Rapidly acquire understanding of specific medical procedures & terminology
- Anticipate impact of HIPAA, IRB regulations, & varying statistical requirements
- Meet w/ external clients, primarily doctors & techs; analyze end-user needs
- Introduce developers, project managers, QA to best-in-class tools / practices
- Formulate development tasks from project requirements & NIH mandates
- Design various software architectures using the Struts framework on Tomcat
- Leverage existing MySql and Oracle DBs / design new relational structures
- Compose strategies for application release, integration, & acceptance
Videographer
Cut Once Productions
Enero 2009 – 2013 (4 taon)
Cut Once Productions provides end-to-end high-definition video services. Whether you are looking to enhance your online presence, capture an important event, or find an editor for your latest film, Cut Once is ready to serve.
Instructor
Cascadia Community College
Abril 2007 – 2010 (3 taon)
Provide the next generation of software developers with the skills they need to thrive. Develop and teach courses covering programming generalities such as algorithm design and web 2.0 methodologies, and specifics such as language syntax and debugging tools.
Senior Programmer/Analyst
Cornell University
2001 – 2004 (3 taon)
- Provide project oversight & technical guidance throughout product lifecycles
- Architect the Division of Financial Affairs' J2EE MVC framework
- Analyze client needs, identify requirements, and design user interfaces
- Identify technologies, patterns, methodologies, and tools for use by team
- Design relational models; port backends from ADABAS to Oracle8i
- Lead and participate in development of all tiers of J2EE web applications
- Mentor interns, novice developers, and experienced non-OOP developers
Software Engineer
Worldstreet Corporation
2000 – 2001 (1 taon)
- Write Servlets to communicate between distributed servers & client apps
- Create and enhance DHTML web interfaces using JSP, JavaScript, and XSLT
- Build stored procedures for MS SQL servers
- Manage JRun, IIS, and SQL servers for development and testing
